sub_title: PhD Candidate at Leiden Institute for Area Studies (LIAS) ׀ Southern Siberia consultant ׀ Wrestling coach
summary:
I am an ethnomusicologist specialised in the performing arts of Turkic-speaking indigenous peoples in Southern Siberia (Sayan-Altay/Altai-Sayan region) with extensive knowledge on language, music and culture of Northern Asian native communities, and broad experience as a Siberia traveller, researcher, author, speaker, culture consultant and project facilitator.

My research focuses on Khakas cultural revitalisation. I also disseminate academic knowledge about Southern Siberian and related Inner Asian cultures to wider audiences through presenting, publishing and project collaboration.
I work for clients and organisations that engage in fostering knowledge and understanding of largely unknown cultures, incl. universities, cultural & educational organisations, concert & festival organisers, media producers, individual researchers & artists.

Always driven by the will to make ethnic minorities of the Russian Federation better known to the world and contribute to the safeguarding of their endangered cultures.

Specialties:
● In-depth musicological, historical and cultural anthropological research
● Texts with an actor-centred approach
● Talks with ample audiovisual illustration, that arouse enthusiasm about matters I am passionately attached to
● Consultancy and cross-cultural facilitation to projects with Russian-speaking artists

Fast Facts about Liesbet Nyssen:
● 20 years of music-ethnographic research in Siberia
● Extensive network in Southern Siberia and related activist, cultural and academic worlds
● Contributions to projects and scholarly exchange in Europe, the U.S., Russian Federation and Kazakhstan

AKA/Misspellings: Liesbet Nijssen, Liesbeth Nyssen, Liesbeth Nijssen, Лизбет Ниссен


I enjoy opportunities for research, consulting work, talks and project collaboration ׀ Altijd op zoek naar nieuwe uitdagingen.


Contact me by sending a request with a personal message, or by sending your message to info[at]liesbetnyssen.nl.

treasury_media.title: www.liesbetnyssen.nl
treasury_media.description: I am an Amsterdam-based musicologist and musical ethnographer. Currently a PhD candidate in anthropology at Leiden University, I am interested in Sayan-Altay music and sound making, storytelling, and dance, with a particular focus on instrument building, indigenous knowledge and notions, post-Soviet urban music-making and identity building, and - most recently - agency in a globalising world.

authors.headline: PhD Candidate at Leiden Institute for Area Studies (LIAS) ׀ Southern Siberia consultant ׀ Wrestling coach

profile_positions.description:
My research zeroes in on
● Post-Soviet culture of Turkic-speaking peoples of the Sayan-Altai / Altai-Sayan region (Khakas, Shor, Northern and Southern Altai): ● Contemporary folk and popular music and dance ● Impact of Soviet cultural policies on today’s performing arts ● Ethnic-cultural revival movements and religious re-awakening ● Role of music and dance in shaping ethnic identities and in community sustainment ● Use by and impact of new technologies and new media on minority communities
● Sayan-Altai indigenous aesthetics of sound, music, storytelling and dance ● Resurgence of ancestral spiritual beliefs and practices (animism, shamanism, Tengriism) in relation to transmission of artistry, performing, creativity, artistic excellence, power of performing
● Inner Asian (Southern Siberian, Mongolian and Eastern Central Asian) myths and legends about origins, practices and power of performing arts (genres, instruments, transmission, creativity, artistic excellence, supernatural capacities)
● the Sayan-Altay zither chatkhan, chadagan, jatagan, jetigen

* Ph.D. research Khakas music after the demise of the Soviet Union

* conference contributions worldwide: Leiden University, World Music and Dance Centre Rotterdam, SOAS/University of London, University of Sheffield, University of Cologne, University of Music and Performing Arts Vienna, Free University of Berlin, University of Cambridge, Memorial University St. John's, Khakassia State University (ХГУ) Abakan, KhakNIIYaLI Research Institute (ХакНИИЯЛи) Abakan, Kazakh National University of Arts (КазНУИ) Astana

* guest lectures and courses: Goethe Universität Frankfurt 1998, KVNM Utrecht 1999, Leiden University 2005, KhGU Institute of Arts Abakan 2005, Kazakh National University of Arts Astana 2011, Università Ca' Foscari Venezia 2013

* research articles – see Publications and my page at Academia.edu 

Currently I am finishing a book about Khakas ethnic and religious music revival since Perestroika (1985–2005).
profile_positions.title: Academic researcher, writer, guest lecturer and speaker

profile_positions.description:
Exploring, recording and researching contemporary urban music and dance, older traditions, instrument building, musical conceptualisations
- in Southern Siberië (Khakassia, Shoria, Altai and Tuva), United States, The Netherlands, Switzerland, Germany, Kazakhstan,
- all together living about 3 years in Khakassia, Siberia.
profile_positions.title: Music-ethnographical fieldwork on music of the Sayan-Altay region and Northern Central Asia

profile_positions.description:
* full-time (fixed-term)
* supervision: prof.dr. J.G. Oosten and dr. W. van Zanten
* subject of research: Khakas music after the demise of the Soviet Union
* working title: "Contemporary chatkhan music: continuity and change"
* scholarships from CNWS, NWO
* output ongoing: several presentations and publications in edited volumes (see below)
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate (AiO) Anthropology of Performing Arts

company.name: concert festival radio programmes, CD labels, individual researchers

profile_positions.company: concert festival radio programmes, CD labels, individual researchers
profile_positions.description:
I collaborated in many projects concerning Southern Siberian (Sayan-Altay, Altai-Sayan) cultures by providing research, fieldwork, advise, facilitation and cultural translation to research trips, cultural projects and media productions, i.a.:

* Research, design, guidance and assistance to research trip to Southern Siberia (Khakassia, Shoria and  Altai) for international team of ethnomusicologists for Smithsonian Folklife Festival, 2001
* Advise and assistance to fieldwork trips of various junior researchers and specialized performers

* Research, advise, assistance, interpretation and cultural translation for festival and concert programming, i.a.: Smithsonian Folklife Festival Washington 2000-2002, ICTM World Conference Vienna 2007, Académie Musicale de Villecroze 2007-2008

* Advise, contents, assistance, exaplanation and interpretation for Radio and TV programmes, i.a.: Khakas radio programme Izenner 2002, Humanistische Omroep 2002, DRS/VOX Television 2002, WDR 3 2002 (received DW/EBU World Music Award 2003), WDR 3 2005

* Research, advise, mediation, cultural translation, interpretation and text contribution to CD productions:
- "Sabjylar - Oghyrlar" (Abakan, 2001-2002),
- "Yulia Charkova: Chitǐ khyllygh chadyghanym - My seven-stringed chadyghan. Songs from the Khakas north" (PAN Records, 2010-2011), and
- "Ensemble Ülger: Traditional songs of the Khakas people" (Face Music, 2012-2013)
profile_positions.title: Southern Siberia (Sayan-Altay) culture consultant and project facilitator

company.name: cultural institutes, concert halls, festivals, symposiums

profile_positions.company: cultural institutes, concert halls, festivals, symposiums
profile_positions.description:
Topics of talks include:
- Travel to Siberia
- Life in Siberia
- Performing arts of Southern Siberia (and Central Asia)
- Ancestral spiritual beliefs and practices (animism, Tengriism, shamanism)	
- Cultural survival of indigenous minority peoples in Southern Siberia
- Impact of New Media

* Introductions to music concerts, inter alia at: Tropentheater, Amsterdam 2002; Wuppertal 2003; Festival "Echo’s uit de Steppen" at Zuiderpershuis (Antwerp) and Tropentheater  (Amsterdam), 2007

* Invited talks for various audiences, most notably:
 - "New Media - Benefit or threat for Khakas music, culture, community?" at Khakassia 2012 Forum, Cheremushki and Festival MIR Sibiri, Shushenskoe, Russian Federation, 2012 (in Russian)
 - “Chakassië” (Khakassia) [about my travels to Khakassia] in Veldmanshuis, Sint-Martens-Voeren, Belgium, 2013
 - “Verkeren met geesten: Anekdotes uit Siberië” (Dwelling with spirits: Anecdotes from Siberia) at Symposium 'Cognitieve Gedragstherapie voor mensen die last hebben van geesten, djinns en magie', Cure & Care Development, Utrecht, 2014
profile_positions.title: Public speaker

profile_positions.description:
Articles, linernotes and programme booklets for general public, among which:
- Ramble through Siberia (CNWS Newsletter 21, 2001)
- Culturele opbloei in Zuid-Siberië (Indigo 2006/4)
- Eine Geschichte vom Nicht-Retten (Von Rettern und Menschen, Gera, 2009)
- linernotes to CD Yulia Charkova. Chitǐ khyllygh chadyghanym - My seven-stringed chadyghan. Songs from the Khakas north (PAN Record 2114, 2011)
- linernotes to CD-series Ensemble Ülger. Traditional songs of the Khakas people (Face Music, 2013) - see Publications below

profile_positions.description:
Facilitating project preparation and performance, enabling communication between project holders and Russian-speaking artists, both in Europe and Siberia.

* Interpretation, cultural translation and moderation of both planned and unforeseen communication between musicians and audiences at festivals, workshops and lectures i.a. at Smithsonian Folklife Festival Washington 2002, Cultureel Centrum Flagey Brussels 2004, Rijksmuseum voor Volkenkunde Leiden 2006, Kazakh National University of Arts Astana 2011

* Hosting, accompanying and facilitating visiting Siberian, Mongolian and Central Asian musicians, assisting them with final preparations for their performances (numerous, since 1997)
profile_positions.title: Facilitator Dutch/English/German – Russian, vv: Cross-cultural communication

Designing and lecturing a series of lectures “Music practices from the Sayan-Altai region: Inspired and engaged by nature, homeland and spirits” in workshop 'Il canto difonico turco-mongolo: tradizioni musicali in Mongolia e nella Siberia meridionale'.

* Introduction to life, religion and performing arts of Altai-Kizhi, Telengit, Teleut, Tuba, Kumandy, Chalkan, Shor, Chulym and Khakas peoples.

among which:
* Introductions of the Khakas chatkhan zither to new audiences (Netherlands; Germany; Het Concertgebouw Amsterdam, 2013

company.name: Noord Azië Instituut Tengri / North Asia Institute Tengri (NAIT)

profile_positions.company: Noord Azië Instituut Tengri / North Asia Institute Tengri (NAIT)
profile_positions.description:
An organisation to promote familiarity with the relatively unknown cultures of Siberian and North Asian cultures in the Netherlands, undertake research and make new connections. 

We initiated and collaborated in a wide variety of projects, most notably:
* CD Altai KhairKhan ‎– Whistle In The Wind -  a joint project with Window To Europe, 2003
* De violen van Djengis Khan / The Violins of Genghis Khan - initiated by Noord-Azië Instituut / North Asia Institute Tengri in collaboration with Stichting Gaudeamus, International Institute for Asian Studies (IIAS), Stichting Prime, Noorderzon Festival, Nieuw Ensemble and Koninklijk Instituut voor de Tropen, Augustus–September 2004
* 4-day festival on Mongolian culture - initiated by Noord-Azië Instituut / North Asia Institute Tengri in collaboration with Koninklijk Instituut voor de Tropen (KIT), International Institute for Asian Studies (IIAS), Consulaat van Mongolië, September 2004
* cooperation in Echo’s uit de steppen Festival - by Window To Europe, November 2007
profile_positions.title: Co-founder
